title: WCAS PSYCH 362-0-20 Cognitive Development
class_attributes:
Social & Behavioral Sciences Distro Area

Attendance at 1st class mandatory

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The focus of this course is an overview of research and theory related to children's cognitive development with a primary focus on infancy and childhood. Among the topics we will cover are concept formation, learning, language, comparative cognition, memory, reasoning, and theory of mind.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Psych 205-Research Methods in Psychology
AND
Psych 218-Developmental Psychology and/or Psych 228-Cognitive Psychology

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Grades will be based on weekly written discussion questions, participation in class discussion, an empirical research proposal, and in class presentation or being a discussion facilitator.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: We will use a number of articles which will be available in the Canvas course management system.
